intro: Phitosia crocifolia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Phitosia crocifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
